item.title: A Reddit Post Led to a Breakthrough in the Brown Shooting Investigation
item.description: A Reddit user provided information that helped identify Claudio Manuel Neves Valente as not only the suspect in the campus shooting, but also the murder of an M.I.T. professor.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn and Qasim Nauman
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: A vehicle is loaded onto a tow truck outside the storage facility in Salem, N.H., where the Brown University shooting suspect’s body was found on Thursday.

item.title: What We Know About the Suspect in the Brown and M.I.T. Killings
item.description: Officials identified a man from Portugal as the suspect in the deadly shooting at Brown University and the killing of an M.I.T. professor. The police said on Thursday he died from a self-inflicted gunshot.
item.dc:creator: Pooja Salhotra
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: Law enforcement officers outside a storage facility on Hampshire Road in Salem, N.H., on Thursday night.

item.title: Trump Administration to Appeal Harvard Funding Case
item.description: Facing a deadline to appeal, the Justice Department told the courts late Thursday that it would try to overturn a judge’s ruling in favor of Harvard.
item.dc:creator: Alan Blinder
item.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Mass.

item.title: Judge Convicted of Obstructing Agents as They Sought Undocumented Immigrant
item.description: The Wisconsin state judge, Hannah C. Dugan, was accused of ushering a man to a side door as federal agents waited outside a courtroom.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman
item.media:credit: Sara Stathas/Reuters
item.media:description: Judge Hannah C. Dugan entered court on the first day of her federal trial.

item.title: Several Billion Dollars Were Lost to Fraud in Minnesota, Prosecutors Say
item.description: Federal prosecutors said they were now investigating fraud worth billions of dollars in 14 social services programs in the state.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño
item.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
item.media:description: Federal agents executed a search warrant as part of a fraud investigation in Minnesota.

item.title: New Judges Take Charge of Sept. 11 Case at Guantánamo
item.description: The long-running case had been on hold for nearly a year because of higher court appeals and the retirement of the military judge.
item.dc:creator: Carol Rosenberg
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: United States Air Force
item.media:description: Lt. Col. Michael Schrama was a student at Georgetown University on Sept. 11, 2001. He is now the fifth judge to preside in the military commission case of defendants in the terrorism attacks.

item.title: James B. Hunt Jr., North Carolina Governor Who Kept State Blue, Dies at 88
item.description: During his 16 years in office, he earned national acclaim for his focus on education. But losing his bid for the Senate in 1984 cost him a shot at the presidency.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Martin
item.media:credit: J. Scott Applewhite/Associated Press
item.media:description: Gov. James B. Hunt Jr. of North Carolina in 1982. He sustained the state’s Democrats as a political force for more than a quarter century, even as he lost a vicious Senate race to Jesse Helms in 1984.

item.title: Democratic State Lawmakers Vow to Unite and Push Back on Trump’s Deportations
item.description: Lawmakers from a half-dozen states said Thursday they will use legislation next year to thwart the tactics of federal law enforcement carrying out immigration policies.
item.dc:creator: David W. Chen
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents and other federal law enforcement officers conducted a street raid in New York in October.

item.title: Trump’s Attacks on Rob Reiner and Others Characterize an Uninhibited 2nd Term
item.description: Many of President Trump’s supporters love his professional-wrestling style of leadership. But some of his recent attacks have sickened even some of his own political allies.
item.dc:creator: Peter Baker
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Mr. Trump’s brash personality has been an element of his appeal to supporters, who find it bracingly authentic in contrast to cookie-cutter politicians.

item.title: Trump Relies on Distortions to Support His Pressure Campaign on Venezuela
item.description: The president has a long record of making false or misleading statements. But the sheer density of them in his administration’s boat attacks and Venezuela pressure campaign is exceptional.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
item.media:description: Mr. Trump says an “armed conflict” makes the killings of people on the vessels lawful, but law-of-war experts say standards for a war to exist are not met.

item.title: U.S. Accuses Venezuelan of Masterminding Tren de Aragua’s Expansion
item.description: The gang, which was the subject of charges brought in several states, is President Trump’s chosen nemesis. The defendant remains at large.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Weiser and Alan Feuer
item.media:credit: Secretaria De Prensa De La Presidencia, via Reuters
item.media:description: A U.S. Air Force airplane carried deportees accused of being members of Tren de Aragua to El Salvador in March.

item.title: The Junior Congressman Who’s Pushing Republicans on Epstein
item.description: The top Democrat on the Oversight Committee, Representative Robert Garcia has brought aggressive tactics and reality-show flair to investigating Jeffrey Epstein’s ties to President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
item.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
item.media:description: Mr. Garcia, 48, is a former mayor of Long Beach, Calif., who has been in Congress fewer than three years. He has been leading Democrats on the Oversight Committee, the House’s top investigative panel, for almost six months.

item.title: Takeaways From the Trial of Wisconsin Judge Hannah Dugan
item.description: The Milwaukee judge was charged with obstructing federal immigration agents, who were trying to arrest a man who had appeared before her on a battery charge.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman
item.media:credit: Sara Stathas/Reuters
item.media:description: Judge Hannah C. Dugan, right, outside the federal courthouse in Milwaukee earlier this week.

item.title: Brown Shooting: Authorities Search for a Person With Possible Connection to MIT Killing
item.description: Investigators are searching f
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush, Chelsia Rose Marcius, Maria Cramer and Alan Blinder

item.title: Kennedy Center Board Moves to Rename It the Trump-Kennedy Center
item.description: The board for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts announced that it would now be named the Trump-Kennedy Center, although a formal change may have to be approved by Congress.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts
item.media:credit: Kent Nishimura for The New York Times
item.media:description: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts was so named by law.

item.title: Cardinal Timothy Dolan Tapped the Power of the New York Pulpit
item.description: From St. Patrick’s Cathedral to the White House to Fox News, he comfortably inhabited many spheres of influence.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Dias, Maya King and Ruth Graham
item.media:credit: Damon Winter/The New York Times
item.media:description: Timothy Dolan was installed as leader of the Archdiocese of New York in a ceremony at St. Patrick’s Cathedral in 2009.

item.title: Trump Signs Order to Ease Restrictions on Marijuana
item.description: Marijuana’s classification as one of the most dangerous and habit-forming substances has long drawn criticism.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater and Ashley Southall
item.category: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
item.media:credit: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump said the move would allow for more research to be done with cannabis.

item.title: 7 Dead After Plane Registered to NASCAR Driver Greg Biffle Crashes, Officials Say
item.description: The authorities did not immediately release the names of the victims. The plane was registered to Greg Biffle, a NASCAR driver, the local sheriff said.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Holpuch and Michael Levenson

item.title: Once Again, Health Care Proves to Be a Bitter Political Pill for G.O.P.
item.description: The inability to find a credible counter to the Affordable Care Act has long bedeviled Republicans and cost them at the polls. It’s threatening to do so again next year.
item.dc:creator: Carl Hulse
item.category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: “It’s a complicated issue, no doubt about it, a lot of moving parts and we have very different visions about what health care ought to look like,” Senator John Thune, Republican of South Dakota and the majority leader, said.

item.title: Democratic Lawmakers Request Review of Howard Lutnick’s Possible Conflicts
item.description: Lawmakers in the House and the Senate asked a government watchdog to determine if Howard Lutnick is following ethics guidelines in promoting data centers that benefit his family’s businesses.
item.dc:creator: Michael Rothfeld and Ana Swanson
item.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang/The New York Times
item.media:description: Democratic lawmakers in the Senate and House have asked the inspector general to examine the intersection between Mr. Lutnick’s actions and the work of his former companies.

item.title: The D.N.C. Is Scrapping Its Report on What Went Wrong in 2024
item.description: Ken Martin, the Democratic National Committee chairman, ordered the autopsy months ago but is now said to believe that its release would be counterproductive for the party.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher
item.media:credit: Annie Mulligan for The New York Times
item.media:description: “Here’s our North Star: Does this help us win?” Ken Martin, the Democratic National Committee chairman, said in a statement about the 2024 audit. “If the answer is no, it’s a distraction from the core mission.”

item.title: Trump Announces $1,776 ‘Warrior Dividend’ for Military
item.description: President Trump promised active duty troops a $1,776 check, citing increased revenue raised by tariffs, but the funding is coming from money for the military included in this year’s domestic spending law.
item.dc:creator: John Ismay and Ali Watkins
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
item.media:description: U.S. service members at Fort Bragg, N.C., in June.

item.title: Palo Alto Confronts Billionaires Over Their Housing Compounds
item.description: The Silicon Valley college town has changed drastically as Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page and other tech founders have scooped up multiple properties.
item.dc:creator: Heather Knight
item.media:credit: Loren Elliott for The New York Times

item.title: Pope Leo Appoints Bishop Ronald Hicks to Succeed Timothy Dolan
item.description: The appointment of Bishop Ronald A. Hicks is expected to bring a markedly different leadership style to New York’s archdiocese.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Dias and Maya King
item.category: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops

item.title: Rob Reiner Family Tragedy Strikes a Nerve for Families Fighting Addiction
item.description: Nick Reiner, charged with murdering his parents, Rob and Michele Singer Reiner, spent much of his life battling drug addiction, an affliction that millions of Americans face.
item.dc:creator: Sonia A. Rao
item.media:credit: Constanza Hevia H. for The New York Times
item.media:description: Pattie Vargas’s daughter and son both struggled with addiction. “As a parent, I would have cut off both my arms to save my kids,” she said.

item.title: ‘Don’s Best Friend’: How Epstein and Trump Bonded Over the Pursuit of Women
item.description: The president has tried to minimize their friendship, but documents and interviews reveal an intense and complicated relationship. Chasing women was a game of ego and dominance. Female bodies were currency.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Confessore and Julie Tate
item.category: Trump Plaza Hotel & Casino (Atlantic City, NJ)
